content.question: Which of the following best explains a consequence of the way power is distributed in a unitary system?

choices.label: Because power is diffused among several levels of government, responses to the needs of citizens are slower and often contradictory.
Because power is shared equally between a national government and subnational governments, public policy is static and cannot change over time.
Because power is concentrated in the national government with some distribution to subnational levels, policy making is often efficient.
Because power is centralized in one place, the national government makes all decisions and there are no other levels of governments.

content.answer: Because power is concentrated in the national government with some distribution to subnational levels, policy making is often efficient.
